column4: if I have disable the restricted ATI driver, what drivers is being subsitute?
is is recommned to use restricted graphics driver for ubuntu?
the answer to that question is more political than anything else, but if it works for you then it's probably best
If I used the propietry driver, watching movies is jerging
what driver are you using?
n/m I need to learn to read up more
the ATI driver shouldn't affect video
the ubuntu build in no problem, but when use the restricted windows driver, problems will come
the ubuntu built in driver is most likely the "vesa" driver.  If that works for you and you don't need hardware acceleration than I suggest you use that one
hardware acceleration is using dedicated hardware to draw stuff on your screen (usually 3d graphics)
then that is probably your best option
how to tell what driver I am using now
try typing 'cat /etc/X11/xorg.conf | grep Driver' into a terminal
though chances are it will say 'fglrx'
nv is the driver you're using then
which is odd as you're using an ATI card
or did I miss something
When I reboot pc it always show nividia FX5200
it is a HP P4 PC
By the sounds of things, you're running an nVidia video card
that's correct
